comment: The predicate "is a monoid". This is the definig theorem of a monoid by showing that a set is a monoid if and only if it is a set equipped with a closed, everywhere defined internal operation (so, a magma, see ~ mndcl ), whose operation is associative (so, a semigroup, see also ~ mndass ) and has a two-sided neutral element (see ~ mndid ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 1-Feb-2020.)
